Package com.github.tadukoo.view.form

Interface Form

All Superinterfaces:
com.github.tadukoo.util.pojo.MappedPojo
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractForm, DateForm
public interface Form
extends com.github.tadukoo.util.pojo.MappedPojo
Form represents a form used in a program that the user can fill out and interact with. It uses FormFields for the fields and buttons and such to be displayed.
Since:
Alpha v.0.2
Version:
Alpha v.0.3
Author:
Logan Ferree (Tadukoo)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addField​(FormField<?> field)
    Adds the given FormField to this Form
    void createComponents()
    This method should be called by the constructor (after calling setDefaultFields()), and will create the components to be used on this Form
    javax.swing.JComponent getComponentByKey​(java.lang.String key)
    Grabs the appropriate JComponent present on this form for the given key for the field
    default boolean labelsOnTop()  
    void saveValues()
    This method can be called by subclasses to update the values present in the form from the Component values
    void setDefaultFields()
    This method should be called by the constructor to set default fields (this is where you should create new FormFields by calling addField(FormField))

    Methods inherited from interface com.github.tadukoo.util.pojo.MappedPojo

    getItem, getKeys, getMap, getPojoItem, getTableItem, hasItem, hasKey, removeItem, setItem

  • Method Details

    • labelsOnTop

      default boolean labelsOnTop()
      Returns:
      Whether to have labels for components above them (true) or to the left (false) - defaults to true

    • addField

      void addField​(FormField<?> field)
      Adds the given FormField to this Form
      Parameters:
      field - The FormField to add to this Form

    • setDefaultFields

      void setDefaultFields() throws java.lang.Throwable
      This method should be called by the constructor to set default fields (this is where you should create new FormFields by calling addField(FormField))
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - If anything goes wrong in creating the fields

    • createComponents

      void createComponents() throws java.lang.Throwable
      This method should be called by the constructor (after calling setDefaultFields()), and will create the components to be used on this Form
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - If anything goes wrong in creating the components

    • saveValues

      void saveValues()
      This method can be called by subclasses to update the values present in the form from the Component values

    • getComponentByKey

      javax.swing.JComponent getComponentByKey​(java.lang.String key)
      Grabs the appropriate JComponent present on this form for the given key for the field
      Parameters:
      key - The key used by the field to find the JComponent
      Returns:
      The appropriate JComponent for the given key for its field
